terms.terms_1: By registering, you agree to all the agreements and terms of RadioVPN
terms.terms_2: Email is the only certificate of RadioVPN, please keep it by yourself
terms.terms_3: RadioVPN will store user passwords with ARGON2I encryption, and all servers run without logs
terms.terms_4: It is forbidden to use the network services provided by RadioVPN to conduct any illegal and malicious activities
terms.terms_5: The use of any service node is subject to the relevant laws of the country to which the service node belongs.
terms.terms_6: For free users, RadioVPN reserves the right to delete accounts without notice
terms.terms_7: Any user who violates the terms of use, RadioVPN will delete the offending account and take back the right to use RadioVPN
terms.terms_8: When purchasing RadioVPN products, no refunds of any kind will be accepted
terms.terms_9: The final interpretation right of this agreement belongs to RadioVPN or its affiliates, and reserves all rights of interpretation and modification

privacy.privacy_1: When you register for a RadioVPN account, the personal registration information you provide upon request
privacy.privacy_2: When you use the network services provided by RadioVPN, or visit RadioVPN web pages, RadioVPN automatically receives and records the information on your browser and computer, including but not limited to your IP address, browser type, language used, access Data such as date and time, software and hardware feature information, and web page records you need
privacy.privacy_3: We will not collect your payment information when you make a purchase or recharge on the RadioVPN website
privacy.privacy_4: The information and data about you collected by RadioVPN is encrypted and stored on overseas servers
privacy.privacy_5: RadioVPN accounts have security protection functions, please keep your user name and password information properly. RadioVPN will ensure that your information will not be lost, abused and altered by encrypting user passwords and other security measures. Despite the aforementioned security measures , but at the same time please note that there are no perfect security measures on the information network
privacy.privacy_6: When using the network services provided by RadioVPN to conduct online transactions, you will inevitably disclose your personal information to the counterparty or potential counterparty, such as contact information or postal address. Please properly protect your personal information, only when necessary If you find that your personal information is leaked, if the RadioVPN username and password are leaked, please contact RadioVPN customer service immediately to take corresponding measures
privacy.privacy_7: Information and data collected by RadioVPN is cleared every seven days

clash.text_2: It is a proxy tool developed in Go language that supports multiple platforms such as Linux/MacOS/Windows/Android, supports ss/v2ray (does not support ssr), and supports rule shunting (similar to Surge's configuration).
clash.text_3: Because the interface or function may not match the tutorial in the long-term update of the client, we recommend that you take this tutorial as a reference only, and you need to be familiar with it according to your own use process.
clash.text_6: Download the client and install it, start the client and do the following
clash.text_11: Click the button above to import the node configuration to Clash with one click
clash.text_13: Then click âˆš in the upper right corner to complete the import
clash.text_14: Open the software again, enter configuration file and select the node configuration just imported
clash.text_15: Can't import with one click? Try setting up subscription manually
clash.text_16: Copy the Clash subscription address first
clash.text_17: Open the APP and enter configuration - select new configuration - URL
clash.text_18: Paste the subscription address into the URL column, fill in the name
clash.text_19: Click save in the upper right corner
clash.text_20: Go back to configuration file and select the node configuration you just imported
clash.text_21: 3. Start the agent and select the node
clash.text_22: Click the stopped button to switch the status to running
clash.text_23: Click the Control Panel button to enter the node configuration interface
clash.text_24: Set the node according to the rules

surfboard.text_2: It is an Android client developed with Surge rules
surfboard.text_3: Because the interface or function may not match the tutorial in the long-term update of the client, we recommend that you take this tutorial as a reference only, and you need to be familiar with it according to your own use process.
surfboard.text_6: Download the client and install it, start the client and do the following
surfboard.text_11: Click the button above to import the node configuration to Surfboard with one click
surfboard.text_12: The phone will automatically open Surfboard and download the subscription configuration automatically
surfboard.text_13: After a few seconds, the download is complete
surfboard.text_14: Can't import with one click? Try setting up subscription manually
surfboard.text_15: Copy the Surfboard subscription address first
surfboard.text_16: Open the APP and enter configuration file , select the + button in the lower right corner
surfboard.text_17: After selecting Import from URL , paste the subscription address into the URL column, click Save in the lower right corner, wait for a few seconds, the subscription configuration is downloaded
surfboard.text_18: 3. Start the proxy and select the node
surfboard.text_19: Click the Dashboard button, then click the Launch icon button floating in the lower right corner
surfboard.text_20: Click the agent button to enter the node configuration interface
surfboard.text_21: Set the node according to the rules
